intro: Platostoma albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower rockrose, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are white to pale pink, typically appearing in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
